{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3354981,"name":"Will","username":"Lakeboy264","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-08T14:19:21.080Z","cooked":"

Hello CD,
Now that DCMP has passed, (our team didn’t qualify for worlds) we are considering looking at testing the Kraken X60s during the offseason. Is there anything that would be good to know about them/settings to apply (like current limits) to avoid browning our robot while testing. (We used Neos this season) We are planning on using the krakens for propulsion and Neos (v1.1) for rotation. We are also planning on trying the MK4i swerve modules rather than the REV modules we used this season. Are there any big red herons that we should look out for when using this motor combo and these modules. Thank you all.

  • Will from Team 8410
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-08T14:19:21.080Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":58,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":346.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461722,"topic_slug":"new-to-krakens-and-mk4is-what-should-we-look-out-for","display_username":"Will","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Chief Logistics Officer and Drive Coach for Team 8410"},"post_url":"/t/new-to-krakens-and-mk4is-what-should-we-look-out-for/461722/1","custom_user_title":"Chief Logistics Officer and Drive Coach for Team 8410","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3354993,"name":"Ronan Melville","username":"Ronan_Melville","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ronan_melville/{size}/222864_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-08T14:27:01.216Z","cooked":"

Theres some helpful info on this thread regarding current limits in this thread:

The Brushless Era needs sensible default current limits General Forum
The brushless motors in available in FRC today are the most powerful motors we’ve ever seen. So powerful, in fact, that you must limit them in software or they’ll affect the performance of your other subsystems, cost you matches, or damage thousands of dollars of sensors on your robot. So why is it so complicated to set current limits? Why aren’t these motors and controllers shipped with sensible current limits out of the box? A story Week 2 Team 2713 blows the main breaker on the robot sev…
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-08T14:27:16.727Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":261,"readers_count":260,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461722,"topic_slug":"new-to-krakens-and-mk4is-what-should-we-look-out-for","display_username":"Ronan Melville","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/the-brushless-era-needs-sensible-default-current-limits/461056","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"The Brushless Era needs sensible default current limits","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56152,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Ronan_Melville"},"post_url":"/t/new-to-krakens-and-mk4is-what-should-we-look-out-for/461722/2","custom_user_title":"Ronan_Melville","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3354997,"name":"cgp","username":"cgp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cgp/{size}/205629_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-08T14:29:34.369Z","cooked":"

They are excellent! Just some common sense suggestions.

Take care assembling. Everything should fit very, very precisely without wiggle. Loctite just about every screw you can and verify after everything is snug after long sessions or matches.

If its not supposed to move loctite it if it is supposed to move grease it… This includes loctite in the ring terminal for the krakens to make sure the screws dont back out dont ask how I know

If you are using CTRE Swerve Generator (only works with all CTRE devices), make sure you set the current limit in the constants file they generate. It defaults to 300 Amps so if you don’t change it, you’ll go through batteries pretty quickly.

I wrote this a few days ago, which is just generally about the MK4 and MK4i:

What swerve do you prefer? General Forum
SDS MK4i and MK4 here, with some pros, cons, and comparative advantages. I’m heavy on the cons because the pros aren’t as interesting nor as easy to identify. Nobody notices good audio; everyone notices bad audio… Also, many of the people assembling these modules were doing it for the first time, so this is biased toward the problems first-time users would see. Common: Pros: same motor interface for drive and steer; no need to maintain stocks of two different motors relatively durable in …

Might be helpful if you’ve never tried the MK4i modules before.
